item.title: 10 Amazing Health Benefits of Uda Seeds
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
Uda seeds are a type of legume native to India. They’re also known as black gram, lentil, and Bengal gram. In India, these seeds are used to make various dishes such as dal, curry, and chutney. Uda seeds contain high amounts of protein, fiber, iron, calcium, zinc, magnesium, phosphorus, potassium, vitamin B6, and folate. These… Read More »10 Amazing Health Benefits of Uda Seeds

item.title: 9 Health Benefits of Sword Beans: Why Are They So Good For You?
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
Sword beans are a type of legume that grows underground. They look like little swords with sharp points. When you dig them up, they taste delicious and are loaded with protein and fiber. They are a great source of protein and fiber. Digging them up is fun and makes you feel like a kid again.… Read More »9 Health Benefits of Sword Beans: Why Are They So Good For You?

item.title: Top 8 Benefits of Tamanu Oil For Skin
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
Tamanu Oil is a natural remedy used by many cultures worldwide for centuries. It has been used as a treatment for acne, eczema, psoriasis, sunburns, burns, cuts, wounds, and even cancer. Tamanu oil is also known to help with hair growth, reduce wrinkles, prevent premature aging, and moisturize dry skin. It’s so effective that it’s… Read More »Top 8 Benefits of Tamanu Oil For Skin

item.title: 15 Benefits Side Effects of Organic Peanut Butter
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
Peanut Butter is one of those foods that everyone loves. But did you know that there are health benefits to eating organic peanut butter? Organic peanut butter has been shown to contain higher levels of antioxidants than regular peanut butter. Antioxidants are compounds that protect cells against damage caused by free radicals.
